### Biostatistics Ph.D. student, Columbia University Mailman School of Public Health

<br><img src="images/julia3.jpg" alt="julia" style="width:25%"><br>

I obtained my B.A. in chemistry from [Swarthmore College](http://www.swarthmore.edu/) in 2010. I am pursuing a Ph.D. in biostatistics from Columbia University, advised by [Jeff Goldsmith](http://jeffgoldsmith.com/). My research focuses on methods for analyzing and visualizing functional data, with recent applications in physical activity and structural MRI.
